intro: Coprosma novaehebridae, commonly known as the Stewart Island coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in spring. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Coprosma novaehebridae is often found in forest understories and is adapted to the cool, moist climate of Stewart Island.
